class_notes: ENVS 225 fulfills the Social Science and Policy Intermediate Breadth requirement for the major
course_description: Introduces theories of human interaction with the environment. Focus is on holistically examining the factors social science research suggests drives human behavior towards natural resources.  Focused on Ostrom's IAD and SES Frameworks.
prerequisites: This course requires ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 or  BIOL_OX 111 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite OR permission of instructor.
schedule_location: TTh 11:30am-12:45pm in New Psyc Bldg 220 (36 Eagle Ro
